snippet: The investigation into the disappearance of a Malaysian airliner underscores how easily false identities can be acquired in global black markets.
abstract: Editorial holds disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has laid bare serious flaws in passenger identity procedures amid what has become booming world market in stolen and counterfeit passports; observes only airports in United States, Britain and United Arab Emirates perform screenings for stolen passports, and urges more widespread adoption of practice.
lead_paragraph: The investigation into the disappearance of a Malaysian airliner underscores how easily false identities can be acquired in global black markets.
